item.title: Report X-2025020362
item.description:
Report X-2025020362

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T06:19:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-04
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO SIXTY AIR PACKAGES THAT WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY EIGHT KILOGRAMS OF DRY ICE COOLING MEDICATION. THE PACKAGE ARE GOING TO VARIOUS ADDRESSES IN THE USA. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING USED TO COOL THE MEDICATIONS. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2025020170
item.description:
Report X-2025020170

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-04
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF states they were unloading trailer 572931 in dock door 29 when they found a pallet of UN1987, ALCOHOLS, N.O.S., 3, PG II that was very loosely wrapped from the previous terminal. ABF Supervisor states that the forklift operator tried to take it out so he could rewrap it but dropped one box conta ining 2 bottles that busted resulting in 24 fl oz to spill out onto the dock.

item.title: Report E-2025020022
item.description:
Report E-2025020022

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-03
  • City: ABILENE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a damaged PAIL containing hazardous product, ZEP morado super cleaner. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 5-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 3’x3’ area and the contractor beneath the trailer in a 10’x3’ area. One PAIL was damaged as a result of improper loading releasing its entire contents. The contractor neutralized and cleaned the release using water and absorbents. One 55-gallon DF was generated containing the damaged pail of product, granular absorbents, shrink wrap, and pallet pieces. XPO will manage all the waste generated from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this release.

item.description:
Report E-2025020043

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-05
  • City: NEVADA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 447000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling on S. State Highway 78 in Nevada, Texas when it drifted off the roadway and rolled over. The trailer was compromised and approximately 4000 gallons of gasoline was released. ES&H Environmental responded to the scene along with the local fire department. The remediation is ongoing.

item.title: Report E-2025020001
item.description:
Report E-2025020001

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-05T03:26:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-27
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 27, 2025, one (1) 1-gallon pail of UN1789 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. The crew utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remove all released material from the dock floor. LSH containerized the damaged pail in one (1) 5-gallon pail and all other debris into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.
